clinical_study.official_title: Nurturing and Quiet Intervention (NeuroN-QI) on Preterm Infants' Neurodevelopment and Maternal Stress and Anxiety: Protocol of a Pilot Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The current state of knowledge reveals that the development of the brain of preterm infants is influenced by specific neonatal experiences during hospitalization, such as environmental sensory stimulation (light and noise), as well as physical and emotional proximity to mothers. However, there is a lack of evidence regarding the benefits that could be associated with the combination of care interventions to improve the health outcomes of preterm infants and their mothers, and in particular the development of the brain of infants during their hospitalization in the neonatal unit. The aim of this pilot study is to assess the feasibility and acceptability of a developmental care intervention including periods of nurturing between mothers and their infant (skin-to-skin contact and auditory stimulation) to promote physical and emotional proximity and a quiet period (controlled light and noise levels and olfactory stimulation in incubators) and to estimate the effect of this intervention on infants' neurodevelopment as well as on maternal stress and anxiety.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility and acceptability of the NeuroN-QI as assessed by a self-completed questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: questionnaire completed by mothers - each question treated separately (no total score)

primary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of the NeuroN-QI as assessed by a self-completed questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: questionnaire completed by nurses - each question treated separately from totally acceptable to totally unacceptable (no total score)

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of the NeuroN-QI as assessed by a self-completed questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: questionnaire completed by nurses - each question treated separately from totally feasible to totally unfeasible (no total score)

secondary_outcome.measure: Estimated effects of NeuroN-QI on infants' neurodevelopment as assessed using the Assessment of Preterm Infants Behavior (APIB)
Estimated effects of NeuroN-QI on infants' neurodevelopment as assessed using the General Movements Assessment (GMA)
Estimated effects of NeuroN-QI on maternal stress as assessed by PSS:NICU
Estimated effects of NeuroN-QI on maternal anxiety as assessed by STAI-Y

secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire completed by nurses - each question treated separately from strongly disagree to totally strongly agree (no total score)

other_outcome.description: birth weight, WGA at birth, postnatal age at the beginning of the intervention, APGAR score, mothers' use of psychological health care resources, other SSC sessions and light and noise levels with soundmeter and light meter

arm_group.description: Each SSC session will last 2-hr during the day including a 15-min of auditory stimulation with maternal voice and controlled levels of NICU light and noise. The 2-hr SSC will be followed by a 1-hr quiet period where infants will rest in their incubator/crib with a pad immersed with their mother breast milk for olfactory stimulation and where the control of light and noise levels will be continued. The NeuroN-QI will be done 4 times/wk for each dyad.

Mothers-infant dyads will do 4 SSC/wk. During these sessions, no attempt will be made by the RA to control the light and noise levels nor to encourage auditory stimulation. The SSC periods will not be followed by a quiet period nor olfactory stimulation.

intervention.description: SSC session lasting 2-hr during the day 4 times/wk including a 15-min of auditory stimulation with maternal voice and controlled levels of NICU light and noise followed by a 1-hr quiet period where infants will rest in their incubator/crib with olfactory stimulation and where the control of light and noise levels will be continued.
